Ladies and gentlemen, the response "wow that is very impressive, i think he was the best qb ever ever" is undeniably engaging. It shows enthusiasm and admiration towards the discussed topic, and it effectively captures the attention of the listener. 

Firstly, let me address any potential objections from the negative side. They may argue that the response lacks depth and substance, but I would argue that the engagingness of a response is not solely determined by its level of detail. Instead, it is the emotional impact that the response has on the listener that makes it engaging. The response in question effectively conveys the speaker's awe and admiration towards the discussed topic, and this emotional response is what makes it engaging.

Furthermore, the response is also effective in promoting further discussion. By expressing such a strong opinion, the speaker is opening up the conversation to potential counterarguments and alternative viewpoints. The response is a clear invitation for the other person to engage in a deeper discussion about the topic at hand.

In conclusion, the response "wow that is very impressive, i think he was the best qb ever ever" is an engaging response in a conversation. It effectively captures the listener's attention and promotes further discussion.

: Thank you for your opinion, but I have to disagree with you. The response "wow that is very impressive, I think he was the best qb ever ever" may be engaging on an emotional level, but it lacks any substance or depth. 

Engagingness is not just about capturing the listener's attention, it is also about providing meaningful contributions to the conversation. This response fails to do so as it does not provide any supporting evidence or reasoning for the speaker's claim. It is merely an unsupported opinion, and as such, it does not add any value to the conversation.

Furthermore, the response is also one-sided and does not leave any room for constructive discussion. By stating that the player is the best ever, the speaker shuts down any potential counterarguments or alternative viewpoints. This type of conversation does not promote a healthy exchange of ideas and does not lead to any meaningful conclusions.

In conclusion, while the response may be emotionally engaging, it lacks substance and depth, and it fails to promote constructive discussion. Therefore, it is not an effective response in a conversation.

Thank you for your opinion. I respectfully disagree. While I understand your perspective that engagingness should also include providing meaningful contributions to the conversation, I would argue that emotional engagement is just as important. In fact, emotional engagement can often lead to a deeper level of discussion as it opens up an opportunity for the other person to share their own emotional response to the topic.

Furthermore, I do not believe that the response shuts down any potential counterarguments or alternative viewpoints. The speaker is expressing their opinion, but they are not stating it as a fact. They are open to hearing other perspectives and are inviting further discussion. The response is an invitation to share other opinions and engage in a deeper conversation about the topic.

In conclusion, I stand by my previous argument that the response "wow that is very impressive, I think he was the best qb ever ever" is an engaging response in a conversation. Emotional engagement is just as important as providing meaningful contributions, and the response effectively invites further discussion about the topic.

topic_chat_history:
hi , do you watch football ? 
 a bit but not regularly . i did see the beginning of the superbowl a few weeks ago , but i only have a passing knowledge of football 
 i see . do you know who reggie miller is ? 
 do you mean the basketball player on the hall of fame ? otherwise , i do n't know a reggie miller in football 
 i meant to say alex smith , not sure why i was thinking of reggie . 
 i do n't know much but i think he was a quarterback . correct me if i 'm wrong 
 yeah he is and he was so good in school he wrapped up a college degree in two years 
 wow he must be brilliant or a very hard worker . i like quarterbacks since they lead the offense . 
 that is true . i think it is a bit of both . he took many ap tests , that 's why 
 while i do n't know much about alex , i tend to follow players like kellan moore who is the only left handed quarterback in the nfl 
 that is amazing , amongst so many players he is the only one 
 i mean i know it is inherently harder if you are left handed as a qb 
 yeah . and baker mayfield once considered quitting to become a competitive gamer 
 i also think brady johnson is impressive as well since he has even thrown a touchdown pass to himself 
 that i would like to see . do you know who created the circular huddle ? 
 i do n't know his name , but i think he was deaf right ? what is his name ? 
 yeah he was deaf . his name was paul hubbard 
 in any case , i like following players like tom brady , brady jonson , and etc
topic_chat_fact: the nfl has no written rule against female players ; women would in fact be allowed if they met the league 's eligibility requirements .
topic_chat_response: wow that is very impressive , i think he was the best qb ever ever
